item.title: Trump aims to 'unleash' local police, but cautions against standing in the way of ICE
item.description: One executive order President Trump signed this week aims to expand legal protections for police accused of misconduct, seeking to establish pro bono legal assistance from private sector attorneys.

item.title: Harvard pledges reforms following internal reports on antisemitism and anti-Arab bias
item.description: The university's president convened two panels to study campus antisemitism and anti-Muslim bias last year. Harvard said it will begin implementing at least some of the reports' recommendations.

item.title: Vietnam War: some families of Vietnamese MIAs are calling on the U.S. to help
item.description: Fifty years after the end of the war, Hanoi says nearly 200,000 Vietnamese soldiers are still missing. Some of their families are now calling on the U.S. to help find them.

item.title: Seeking Closure 50 Years After the End of the Vietnam War
item.description: Fifty years ago this week Communist forces seized the city of Saigon bringing an end to the Vietnam war. It was a war that defined a generation with effects that reverberate today. We go to Laos were one man's search for closure takes him to the top of the tallest mountain.

item.title: White House dismisses authors of major climate report
item.description: The Trump Administration dismissed all the scientists working on the next National Climate Assessment. The report is the most comprehensive source of information about climate change in the U.S.

item.title: The only female unit to serve overseas in WWII gets a congressional medal 80 years on
item.description: The Six Triple Eight sorted millions of pieces of wartime mail in a matter of months but weren't recognized publicly for decades. Just two of the 855 women are believed to be alive for the ceremony.

item.title: Dachau's memorial marks 80 years since the liberation of the Nazi concentration camp
item.description: The Dachau memorial is hosting commemorative events and dedicating a plaque in honor of the U.S. Army's 45th Infantry Division that first encountered prisoners alive at the camp 80 years ago.

item.title: How Project 2025 is shaping Trump's second term
item.description: Journalist David Graham says the aim of the creators of the conservative action plan Project 2025 is to push the federal government "as far to the right as they can." His new book is The Project.
